item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
This does appear to be the case. Somewhere along the line, someone must have forgotten to update the total achievable awesome in the article. There should probably be some mention of the item 'The Eleven', since having 21 gets 15 awesome. And the trophies by themselves seem to add up to 1201 ranked, 1181 points to actually spend.

(-10) + (1) + (5 * 26) + (10 * 42) + (20 * 25) + (40 * 2) + (60) = 1181.
"The Eleven" and the point difference for ranking give the 1216 unboosted value on the high scores. And the boost is only 11, so that gets the 1227 value.

I'd add the change myself, but I'm not a 'member' of the wiki yet.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Looks like both Catprog and Raaaak have 1216 unboosted awesome. Looks like that's the most at the moment, considering the boosted awesomeness highest people have 1227.

item.title: Secretest Trophies

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Corrected the text of the Trophy.

You get it for choosing a side, regardless of which one you choose.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: If there's a secret trophy for doing the order quest, should there not be one for choosing chaos, as well? That, or the Choosing Sides trophy is unlocked by beating either quest…I would sincerely doubt that McM would make someone miss 20 awesome permanently, just because they picked the wrong side.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
The Jutsu only comes at Jonin.
The Kunai only comes when you have the Jutsu.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: So, did we ever get any confirmation that those with Past Connections get a sealed kunai, regardless of rank/bloodline?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: See, there's something I never understood: If you get FTGT, would you GET a sealed kunai as you do as Legacy? If not, wouldn't *THAT* item be worthless? Also, they may want to check the coding on this page; "Initial Drifter" has the "Limitless Focus" tab in it. Click on "Initial Drifter" and scroll down a bit— you'll see what I mean.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Wait…you still need Jonin? The Advanced RedEye page says that you only need to be a genin if you have the Inherent Perception awesome ability to have the jutsu…and I would assume the same would hold true for the WhiteEye/Legacy jutsu awesome abilities…otherwise that would be rather unbalanced…

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Actually, you don't have them as Genin. You don't get them until you hit Jonin, same as if you were the proper bloodline.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Well, there's a couple of reasons for getting Bloodline Awesome abilities.
1. Having more than one, as you said (having FTGT, Advanced WhiteEye, *and* Advanced RedEye? Awesome!)
2. You keep them when looping. So you not only have all 3, you have them as a Genin. That alone could make it worthwhile. Though FTGT doesn't work as well then, due to lack of sealed kunai…

item.title: Loopjutsu?
item.content:encoded: If you've bought the Eighth Trigram, Inherent Perception, and/or the Past Connection awesome abilities, which give the Advanced WhiteEye/Advanced RedEye/Flying Thunder God Technique jutsu, would you keep those jutsu when you loop, because you got it from an awesome ability, which *does* loop?

item.title: Bought Extra Bloodlines
item.content:encoded: you are not buying the bloodline, you are just buying the special jutsu that is only available to that bloodline. When you loop, you lose the trade, reaper, wasteland , robo, and your basic bloodline and you get a new basic. Only eye of the storm and power of greass bloodlines loop

item.title: Bought Extra Bloodlines
item.content:encoded: If you buy extra bloodlines with your awesome, do those bloodlines loop with you? Or do you lose them when u loop and go back down to having only 1 basic bloodline?
